Las Rozas was, in the 1970's a small rural village of some 6000 inhabitants. Today it is a thriving feeder town for the capital city, and home to about 100,000 relatively wealthy, middle-class souls. It is still formally a

or rural district policed by Guardia Civil rather than national police - but it has a municipal police force, and a well-equipped Regional fire department with helicopters and landing pads to fight bush-fires. 

It has excellent modern cultural, shopping and leisure facilities, but is not really a visitor centre, so you can see how ordinary Spaniards live the good life, and enjoy prices without paying a tourist premium.

, to the west of the capital city, which links via a toll-road to the thee concentric peripheral routes M-50 (outer) M-40 and M-30 (inner) autovías. There are also direct rail and metro services from Terminal 4.

Use either M-50, M-40, or M-30 peripheral major roads around Madrid which connect to A-6 (Autovia A Coroña) Las Rozas is at Km 23. There are no traffic lights in the town, but some glorious landscaped and schemed roundabouts to enjoy. The M-50 ring road ends here - but it is planned to close the circle to make the airport more accessible.
The town has four main zones

value: Casco Antiguo is the old town arount the city hall
Parque Paris is a large residential zone along the M-505 road to El Escorial
El Cantizal - a huge residential zone and Football City, Las Rozas Village etc.
Las Matas A-4 at Km 27, originally the  road-builders camp and then a major railway depot, now home to Madrid's Railway museum and RENFE Applied magnetics laboratory and Talgo train factory.
Town center, pedistrian Calle Real & town hall square with several cafés
Parque Paris - landscaped ornamental lake, children's zones two cafés
El Largo (not same business as town centre café of same name)
Visit Fiesta del patron del pueblo: San Miguel - One week  around 29th September - funfair, concerts street parades etc.
(Cercanias: Pinar station is near Campanile hotel)
Trek or cycle in nature parks near Football City, around the sports stadium (A-6 Km 23) or along Rio Guardarama (car park off roundabout M-505 at Km 7)
Visit Railway Museum at Las Matas (A-4 Km 27)
Visit Real Federación Espaañola de Fútbal national football team ground and museum at Cuidad de Fútbal (Parque Empresarial)

but yummy bread, cakes, pies and chocolates to die for!

Calle de la Cornissa 18 - difficult to find (M-505 Km 1, A-6 service road south, and follow signs and keep going down narrow streets - it's there!), not cheap, but always a delight
